140CFA5FB1434CECA492B65D817DE86F.description:
The Church observes Lent as a time for prayer, good works and
sacrifice.

51A4D91BF80147FBAC8D40EC14AE4910.description:
The Church observes Advent as the beginning of the Liturgical year, a
time of prayer and preparation of Christ anew.

5471EDA0115A43A1AACB7F0BC7EC4864.description:
The Liturgical year moves through the seasons of the year in the following order: Advent, Christmas, Ordinary Time, Lent,
Triduum, Easter, Ascension, Pentecost, and then resumes
Ordinary Time.

29E4057C5A964AC5A7D34A3C58C1BCE5.description:
The Liturgy of the Eucharist is a sacrificial memorial and a
sacramental meal in which Jesus Christ is truly present.

5EFDA4413CC146FCB4FCEBAC45BBF50C.description: In the Liturgy of the Word, the Church listens to and responds to the Word of God found in scripture.

92B33BF1D3D44A83B0706FC8F9FA6A17.description: In the celebration of the Divine Liturgy, the whole of the Paschal Mystery is celebrated and remembered, Jesus Christ is fully present.

1DB493090B134C43A44D65409AF0CBF7.description:
Liturgy is the public prayer of the Church in which the members are
active and full participants.

A73CB06112254EB982202C8FB32ED3D1.description: THE PASCHAL MYSTERY OF·JESUS CHRIST IS CELEBRATED IN THE DIVINE LITURGY

C6B27567B9284924B385F4F8D1757DD3.description: The Sacraments of Healing are Penance and Reconciliation and Anointing of the Sick. Jesus Christ heals our souls and bodies.

34B6B87B4A3C4C438E91CF7F9F157EF2.description:
The Sacraments at the Service of Communion are Holy Orders and
Matrimony. Holy Orders is the Sacrament in which men commit their lives to Jesus Christ in service of the Church. In Matrimony, a man
and a woman commit themselves to each other in a lifelong and lifegiving love.

75A1DC359DF8435398806FBFA962AA55.description:
The Sacraments of Christian Initiation are Baptism, Eucharist and Confirmation. They are the foundation of our Christian life as followers
of Jesus Christ, and make us full members of the Church.

488C43F5146E4A36BA136CBD08A07037.description:
Instituted by Jesus Christ, the seven sacraments are visible signs of an invisible reality. Jesus Christ is present in the sacraments. Jesus
shares God's life with Christians through the sacraments.

B1CB5208982C44C6A07600E0B8D6027C.description: The Paschal Mystery is celebrated and communicated through the sacramental life of the Church.

113E815163DF48BAB675FF7170AA049C.description: THE CHURCH CONTINUES THE MINISTRY OF JESUS CHRIST THROUGH THE SACRAMENTS

67D10015A6874C7199A955920EDEEC28.description: The pope, bishops and pastors lead and guide the Church, and are the successors to the Apostles and their teachings.

36F9A7F83A6641B7A3605DC9F841BB18.description: Apostolic - The Church is faithful to the teachings of the Apostles.

EAC7177A62704173987D3DD51ECD3E44.description:
Catholic - The Church is universal. The Church seeks to bring
salvation to all people.

7103CD85625541D9985DF58C73A3F3DC.description:
Holy - God calls us to holiness and the Holy Spirit unites the Church
to continue the work of Jesus Christ.

577B2761E7364B6096F1563C976AFF8C.description: One - The Church is the people of God gathered in the name of Jesus Christ.

A6F391F3219A43EFAF998076AF6F08F1.description:
The Church has four marks, The Church is One, Holy, Catholic and Apostolic. The four marks of the Church are inseparably linked with
each other and indicate the essential features of the Church and her
mission.

2D0122F91C3A407CA432453619B1913B.description: JESUS CHRIST IS MADE VISIBLE IN THE FOUR MARKS OF THE CHURCH

92613CE3E3284F56AA0A94C1E428841A.description: The language of prayer can include words, melodies, gestures and art.

F4E5D6229C5E402B86960DA3634EA06A.description: Types of prayer include: Prayers of Petition and Intercession; Prayers of Blessing and Adoration; and Prayers of Praise and Thanksgiving

F740F71939B44DA8B1F5452ACB369771.description:
Personal prayer is a conversation with God in which we open our
hearts, souls and minds to encounter God.

DED067FC9F9F4F59B0AE95598FB940B0.description:
The Church prays for both the living and the dead as a way of
lifting them to Heaven and offering our love for them.

1993126A8C164CA89678BFEC5B6AD325.description:
The members of the Church have a special obligation to attend Mass on Sundays and Holy Days of Obligation, and are encouraged to pray
daily.

B150D80921D442D0A766518D1C59BA3A.description:
The Lord's Prayer, given to us by Jesus Christ, is the most perfect of prayers and is a summary of the Gospel message of
Jesus.

77E7C788260D4923B38FF7591AF81E78.description: The Sign of the Cross is a reminder of the Blessed Trinity and of our redemption by the cross.

958CC79D57E24FBD92E47E92ABE46555.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS HIS FOLLOWERS TO A LIFE OF PRAYER

950767D8A8BD41FEB3E0D92B660467E7.description:
As disciples of Jesus Christ, we have a responsibility to care for others, sharing our time, talent and treasure to build up the Kingdom
of God.

4C96C6BCEA8B485698764FE4F8490872.description: As disciples of Jesus Christ, the Church continues Jesus' work and evangelization today.

B24252AC69FE42908FFAB93C977F0339.description:
All members of the Church share in the Church's mission to help those in need, especially the most vulnerable or those seeking peace
and justice.

6F856FEC25304B4F8E46A5706AE6350C.description:
The Theological Virtues of Faith, Hope and Love are the foundation of
Christian moral activity.

F1971BCBCC5848EC95BABAECB5660B67.description:
The Gifts of the Holy Spirit and the teachings of the Church help a person develop a conscience, make good choices and avoid
sin. Sin always harms one's relationship with God and the
Church family.

8D673BA123AA43BFB27C29EF28FE3D8B.description:
Jesus Christ is our example of holiness. Jesus lived His life in
perfect love of God the Father and in service to others. The entire Gospel Message is contained in the Great Commandment of
Jesus to love one another as He loves us. This commandment
requires a commitment of the heart.

48ED1032A3AC48719EE9BDA220A82432.description:
Jesus Christ calls each of us to know, love and serve God with all of our strength (heart, mind, soul and our neighbor as
ourselves).

1B5F1EE0652A49C797AD27D2140D197A.description: JESUS CALLS HIS FOLLOWERS TO LIVE A MORAL LIFE

8968AF1B95064206B3086E39B178EAFA.description:
Mary has a special place in the Church as the Mother of God and
as the Mother of the Church.

AB2C1E1B9C814D7C9A9FC6CDCEF7E1C6.description:
The Communion of Saints is the entire community of God's people, living and dead. It includes those in heaven, those living
as God's people on earth and those in Purgatory, waiting to be
with God.

A6DBB706E84F466FA807F9EE4465CBE5.description:
The Church is the Body of Christ to which all members belong. There is a diversity of her members and functions, but Christ
unites all members to one body.

E48FA1133FB4406AB3CDEF409FDAD1EC.description:
The Holy Spirit resides in the Church, guiding and assisting the
Church to carry on the mission of Jesus Christ.

9893BB9C51204CA4BF18FD29A04F820B.description:
At Pentecost, the Holy Spirit was poured out upon the Apostles and followers to empower them to continue the mission of Jesus
Christ. Pentecost is known as the birthday of the Church.

5A5DA5224C284E9C89E05F194CD2D583.description:
Jesus Christ promised to send the Holy Spirit to be with the Church, the community of believers, to unite, guide and continue
the work of Jesus Christ.

5B2B420257C146348BA997974260D7AA.description: THE HOLY SPIRIT CONTINUES THE MISSION OF JESUS CHRIST THROUGH HIS CHURCH

823D7ED40D724283844BA18E78A05198.description: Christians profess Jesus Christ as Lord, acknowledging His divinity.

BFB55E9184204F68972237F9583CDE74.description: Jesus ascended into Heaven and will come again to judge the living and the dead.

D2AC2DCA8CD44A88921B7B706C3FE3CD.description: Through his suffering, death and resurrection, Jesus Christ makes salvation possible to all who believe in him, and are faithful to his teachings. Through belief in the Paschal Mystery the faithful will obtain everlasting life.

DA05BCD03A264475815728FFB2DEAD13.description: The Beatitudes are at the heart of Jesus Christ's preaching and serve as a guide for the Church to build up the Kingdom of God.

DA3889DD97CA4CD5A91AB98F67FB7BA2.description:
Jesus Christ uses the parables to teach about the Kingdom of God. The parables are Jesus' invitation to enter into the Kingdom. The
Church is a sign of the Kingdom of God.

72B9874FEFE14A70AA0387E7EDF83B6C.description: Jesus Christ, Son of the living God, is alive and present in the Church.

93DF0DF120EB467BA234D48570D28F5D.description:
God the Father created everything through Jesus Christ by the Holy Spirit and all creation shows God's love, goodness, and
order.

7907E64DDE8145BA9907B8D8AE6F968F.description:
The Holy Trinity is the mystery of one God in three divine
persons: God the Father, God the Son and God the Holy Spirit.

8BFEF6B900BD4E669C357EE780531DD0.description: THE HOLY TRINITY AND THE ROLE OF JESUS CHRIST IN THE SALVIFIC PLAN OF GOD

7DEF2183EC3D426C8FF9841EBE4EEDF4.description: Faith Theme: Jesus' Life and Work Continue Through His Church

D5B384BC52F74FD7A1AC72BA7ED9F779.description: Our Father, Hail Mary, Glory Be

3F91138246F54A44B9FCD370D580DFCF.description: The Liturgical year moves through the seasons of the year in the following order: Advent, Christmas, Ordinary Time, Lent, Triduum, Easter, Ascension, Pentecost, and then resumes Ordinary Time.

273A1FFD7B784F4AB6B24DED94032B47.description: THE PASCHAL MYSTERY OF JESUS CHRIST IS CELEBRATED IN THE DIVINE LITURGY

85702B11DBDF42E3B04049674624EFA9.description: The pope, bishops and pastors lead and guide the Church, and are the successors to the Apostles and their teachings.

8286290563F94E6D99751CB272E3AEB5.description: JESUS CHRIST IS MADE VISIBLE IN THE FOUR MARKS OF THE CHURCH

2BF9987ECB954C02B85112F83FE9767C.description: Personal prayer is a conversation with God in which we open our hearts, souls and minds to encounter God.

B8108D2A7AB34D7EB45D6E173591CA7C.description: The Church prays for both the living and the dead as a way of lifting them to Heaven and offering our love for them.

3E22D1B915724F3E8B097543713D6643.description: The Lord's Prayer, given to us by Jesus Christ, is the most perfect of prayers and is a summary of the Gospel message of Jesus.

D6FC359C88864F4DBA4EC25CFB9A034C.description: The Sign of the Cross is a reminder of the Blessed Trinity and of our redemption by the cross.

ABCC0B17B3F2482589286D1580E49963.description: JESUS CHRIST CALLS HIS FOLLOWERS TO A LIFE OF PRAYER

2A8AE5746F824A19AEBBFE45656DB744.description: The Gifts of the Holy Spirit and the teachings of the Church help a person develop a conscience, make good choices and avoid sin. Sin always harms one's relationship with God and the Church family.

DB035E2D46E845BDB64948F3E0219905.description:
Jesus Christ is our example of holiness. Jesus lived His life in perfect love of God the Father and in service to others. The entire Gospel Message is contained in the Great Commandment of Jesus to love one another as He loves us. This commandment requires a
commitment of the heart.

1C317A37D1B0481E8243CC08BF68B29F.description: Jesus Christ calls each of us to know, love and serve God with all of our strength (heart, mind, soul and our neighbor as ourselves).

DC7F383955BC46079C0C7376C4A6EF69.description: JESUS CALLS HIS FOLLOWERS TO LIVE A MORAL LIFE

11865CF1A9954CB49134EA859EC7EF00.description: Mary has a special place in the Church as the Mother of God and as the Mother of the Church.

A61FC4944D9641DFB4A88A14BB062F4D.description: The Communion of Saints is the entire community of God's people, living and dead. It includes those in heaven, those living as God's people on earth and those in Purgatory,  waiting to be with God.

3E22C98039784B1AB3A29E7C7F97A5A9.description: The Church is the Body of Christ to which all members belong. There is a diversity of her members and functions, but Christ unites all members to one body.

4D9D3430B9DC4724967446B116A99C72.description: The Holy Spirit resides in the Church, guiding and assisting the Church to carry on the mission of Jesus Christ.

35C191FD44214C079605D23FA180D328.description: At Pentecost, the Holy Spirit was poured out upon the Apostles and followers to empower them to continue the mission of Jesus Christ. Pentecost is known as the birthday of the  Church.

CEEA698A713C4D098817109A81EF2FB0.description: Jesus Christ promised to send the Holy Spirit to be with the Church, the community of believers, to unite, guide and continue the work of Jesus Christ.

AF73E2DED21A4910980D614AA96E5F09.description: THE HOLY SPIRIT CONTINUES THE MISSION OF JESUS CHRIST THROUGH CHURCH

C66CDA1160794592BC67270C9B5BFD23.description: Jesus Christ, Son of the living God, is alive and present in the Church.

1E1339B8F9DF42ED821F56E9F197496E.description: God the Father created everything through Jesus Christ by the Holy Spirit and all creation shows God's love, goodness, and order.

C57812631181462182C2FF7011C45164.description: The Holy Trinity is the mystery of one God in three divine persons: God the Father, God the Son and God the Holy Spirit.

76B33E138D404B5CBA50F889903E335B.description: THE HOLY TRINITY AND THE ROLE OF JESUS CHRIST IN THE SALVIFIC PLAN OF GOD
